required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tour de Borobudur Troponin Study on Predictors and Synergistic Role of MDA and Hs-CRP Levels
clinical_study.official_title: Predictors of Cardiac Troponin Release After Tour de Borobudur 2017

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Research, Technology and Higher Education, Republic of Indonesia

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective observational study to determine predictors that related to cardiac troponin I (cTnI)release, malondialdehyde (MDA) and high sensitivity C Reactive Protein (hs-CRP) after Tour de Borobudur (TdB) 2017

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligible Criteria:
1. minimum sample size of 80 men, non athlete, participants of TdB
2. Classified into two groups: 160kms cycling and 100kms cycling participation
3. 25-55 years old
4. voluntary participate in the research
5. eligible in pre participatory physical examination and ECG test by doctor
6. have no history of previous acute coronary syndrome (ACS)
Measurments:
Interview for determine predictors of sports particapation history, medical history, family medical history and Rate of Perceived Exertion Measurement and examination to determine: antropometry parameters, clinincal conditions (SBP, DBP, hemoglobin levels, T-cholesterol and HDL-C levels, intensity in cycling activities (mileage, velocity, duration, and time for resting), hemodynamic responses (average and maximum heart rate, Karvonen Index), and Hydration status
Other outcome measurements; pre and post TdB2017 measurements of cTnI, MDA, and hs-CRP

primary_outcome.description: specific protein to determine cardiac injury

arm_group.description: willing to participate in 160kms cycling touring of TdB 2017
willing to participate in 100kms cycling touring of TdB 2017

intervention.description: main exposure is long distance cycling touring (TdB) consists of two groups; 160kms and 100kms

study_pop.textblock: participants of Tour de Borobudur Indonesia 2017

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- minimum sample size of 80 men, non athlete, participants of TdB
- Classified into two groups: 160kms cycling and 100kms cycling participation
- 25-55 years old
- voluntary participate in the research
- eligible in pre participatory physical examination and ECG test by doctor have no history of previous acute coronary syndrome (ACS)
Exclusion Criteria:
- stop cycling before finish line due to mechanical or bicycle related errors
- (subjects who stop cycling due to any physical symptoms and health related problem included in analysis)
